intro: Pedilonum oreodoxa, commonly known as the common pedilonum, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes aromatic herbs such as carrots and parsley. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in umbel-like clusters. It is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks. Pedilonum oreodoxa is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
